title: 10 Mb/s Ethernet Standardized (IEEE 802.3)
overview: The IEEE 802.3 working group finalizes the 10 megabit per second Ethernet standard, setting the baseline for high-speed LANs that later form Internet backbones.

title: 100 Mb/s Fast Ethernet
overview: Fast Ethernet is standardized, delivering a tenfold performance increase over classic Ethernet, and becomes common in enterprise LAN backbones.

title: 1 Gb/s Gigabit Ethernet
overview: Gigabit Ethernet emerges as the backbone technology of choice for ISPs and data centers, scaling Internet core capacity.

title: 10 Gb/s Ethernet
overview: The IEEE ratifies 10 Gigabit Ethernet (802.3ae), introducing fiber-based backbone speeds for metro, enterprise, and data center networks.

title: 40 Gb/s & 100 Gb/s Ethernet
overview: The IEEE approves 40G and 100G Ethernet (802.3ba), marking the first time two speed grades are standardized simultaneously for backbone deployments.

title: 400 Gb/s Ethernet
overview: The IEEE ratifies 400 Gigabit Ethernet (802.3bs), enabling hyperscale data centers and tier-1 ISPs to scale backbone throughput dramatically.

title: 800 Gb/s & 1.6 Tb/s Ethernet Trials
overview: Vendors and research networks trial 800G and 1.6T Ethernet links, testing next-generation optical modules and switch ASICs for backbone scaling.
